definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: The voice of the mournful chanter called to dolorous prayer.
sentences.chinese: 哀恸的领唱人的声音向哀伤的祷告者呼唤。

sentences.english: She chanted hymns and prayers with the voice of a cantor.
sentences.chinese: 她用圣诗领唱者的嗓音吟唱赞美诗和祈祷词。

sentences.english: Sister Tan Ay Eeng was the song leader of that night.
sentences.chinese: 当晚的领唱是陈爱萤师母。

sentences.english: Nan Nan Mang says that this is the guiding musician, Moncler Jackets, the below is warmhearted cheerful.
sentences.chinese: 楠楠忙说这是领唱，下面就有热烈懽快的。

sentences.english: Serving as a Sunday School teacher and worship leader in church.
sentences.chinese: 在教会是一名主日学老师，并担任崇拜领唱。

sentences.english: Jenny sang the lead. the rest joined in the chorus.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮领唱，其他人参加合唱。

sentences.english: About 45 precent students go to school without breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 大约45领唱学生不吃早饭去上学。

sentences.english: And the lead singer can improvise a lot.
sentences.chinese: 领唱歌手也可以有很多即兴发挥。

sentences.english: At the concert, Charles led the singing and Paul played the piano.
sentences.chinese: 在音乐会上，查理斯领唱，鲍尔用钢琴伴奏。

definition: vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
announce the items on a (theatrical) program
sung performance/to sing for an audience
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
